intro: Diplazium angulosum, commonly known as the angular fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Hemionitidaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, angular fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are bi-lobed and have a serrated edge, contributing to its unique appearance. Diplazium angulosum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
